content.question:
Felip recorded 75 numerical observations on a certain variable and then calculated the mean <math alttext="x bar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math> and the standard deviation <math alttext="s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the observations. To help decide whether a normal model is appropriate, he created the following chart.

In Felip’s chart, the letters <math alttext="a, b, c, d, and e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of observations falling in each interval. Which of the following lists of counts for <math alttext="a, b, c, d, and e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively, is the best indicator that the variable can be modeled with a normal approximation?
